WRITING.TEXT: Thank you. I don't know what to take. My hormone test turned out perfect, but I have a lot of sintoms of hormonal disorder: acne, facial hair, overweight... I started taking Myo Inositol and I'm starting D Chyro Inositol this week. I'm also taking Vitamin D3 and Spearmint Capsules, I was thinking to add some suplements, but I don't know which one can help my condition. The only thing my blood panel showed was high triglycerids. The rest was ok. (I'm on keto) Do you have a recommendation for me maybe...?

I cut dairy two months after starting keto because I wasn't loosing weight and I thought it could be that. I stopped eating creams, milk and greek yogrut. The only milk derivate food I'm still eating is cheese... Could be cheese?
Is Dim Plus similar to DMAE or DHEA?
I'm taking Vitamine D3 and Myo-Inositol, and starting D-Chyro-inositol this week. I've seen improvement in my weight and my energy.

I have PCOS, I had a hormone and blood panel test three weeks ago and everything was fine, just my triglycerids were high. The thing that I changed when I started keto was eating a lot more cheese (appart from cutting carbs and sugar).

I took a quick picture...
http://i.imgur.com/wc14tbD.jpg

Bioderma micellar wter is new, I've always used Avene micellar wter, but the derm recommended me this one for oily skin. I bought the pink powder after I started breaking out and I apply it just on the spots. It seems to dry them but I'm not sure, I'm kind of overwhelmed with what to do with the actual spots. In fact, after I started breaking out I bought a bunch of things for the acne itself, but I cut them all when I saw everything made them worst. I was using and a point:
*Paula's Choice BHA 2% *Paula's choice gel cleanser (I don't remember the exact name, sorry) *Tea tree oil *Epiduo *Topical antibiotics (called Eridosis) *Neostrata AHa 15 salicylic acid *Cosrx Power liquid
And a bunch more of stuff that I don't remember (I'm at work now) Now, I'm just using what I wrote before, the Heliocare and Avene cleanser I've used them for years, it can't be that...
Regarding food, the only dairy I consume is cheese, if is that, I'm actually eating a lot of cheese since I started keto, other tan that, no sugar at all, not dairy, not creams...
Could you send me a link to your pictures, I click in your name and it leads me to a place with all your posts, but I don't know how to make a search. :/
I'm not sure what they are, they are big and deep, the main place where I break out is my cheeks, over and over in the same spots. They heal very very slow. I think is cystic acne, but I'm not sure, Could you tell me what it is if I post a picture?
Edit: I'm not using make up now. After I broke out I read about the pilow case changing, and I'm doing it every other day. Brushes, I need to clean them, but I'm not using them at all...

I didn't patch test at all :/ I received the products and I used them all together for a week or a bit longer. I even used samples in between... Then I posted something about me breaking out and a redditor from SCA or AB told me about test patching and advised me to cut every product and stick to my old cleanser and sunscreen until I cleared up. I've been two weeks using just Bioderma Sebium micellar water, Avene gel cleanser and Heliocare sunscreen and Mizon pink powder on the spots. Some days they seem to heal, but then, I have a new horrible pimple. That's why I'm thinking maybe is not the routine, because I also changed my diet at the same time and didn't think that keto could be what was causing it...

WRITING.TITLE: Can keto cause acne?
WRITING.TEXT: I,ve been on keto since april. A few weeks later I changed my skincare routine and 10 days later I had an acne break out. Every day since that my acne has get worse. I asked the doctor for a blood test and only thong different was high triglycerids. I went to the dermatologist and he prescribed me Epiduo but my pimples keep popping up and now I,m not using anything that can do that to my skin. So I have no clue about what can cause it. I,m starting thinking maybe my skin doesn,t like this WOE... ( Otherwise I feel great with keto) I just thought I may ask to see if some of you have experience something similar and/or have a piece of advise.

I don,t know what is causing it. My blood panel was normal with high triglycerids, hormones normal too. I have acne since april. I started using new skincare products one week before, so I think maybe that,s the cause but I have stopped using them and still break out a couple times a week. Thanks for your advise.

WRITING.TITLE: Supplements advise for my next order.
WRITING.TEXT:
Hello,
I have a discount coupon from BulkPowders, I buy Inositol there and the quality is excelent. I was thinking about ordering a few more things, and I would really appreciate your advise in this.
I'm 31yo woman in keto diet for loosing weight. I have PCOS, high triglycerids and mild acne. I'm taking:
-Inositol. -D-Chiro-Inositol. -Vitamin D3 1000ui/day -Pysillium fiber. -Spearmint leaf full spectrum capsules.
Thank you very much. I'm going to see the link. Don't worry, your comment is perfect :)

Well... I don't see exactly a pattern, Ive notice that:
*The battery doesn't last more than an hour despite I've bought two new Samsung original batteries over the course of 2 years. *When I connect it to the charger the alarm screen pops up and freezes (I have to unplug it or turn it off for it to stop doing that, it drives me crazy). *When I lock the screen a google chrome page appears on the screen (I've cleaned the cookies and internet history a thousand times). *It has an strange square in the middle of the main screen with a partial view of my gmail. It's impossible to remove it.
It does a few more things...
i reseted it a few weeks ago and it stopped doing some of the weird stuffs, but most of them persist.

WRITING.TITLE: [Need help] CAn I do something with my Samsung Galaxy S4?
WRITING.TEXT:
Hello,
I really hope you can help me... I can't by a new Smartphone at the moment, but my current Samsung Galaxy S4 is completely crazy: a lot of Windows pop up in the screen, the alarm starts sounding anytime and a long list of weird stuffs. So, I have been reading a couple of posts here about XDA and ways of rebooting (I don't know if this term is correct) the pone, and I really have the time and disposition to try to figure out how to sabe my phone, but I need to know where to start... I have been trying to read the forum of XDA and I'm so lost. So if yoou may help me to find a starters guide or something like that, it would be awesome.
Thank you, very kind! I think I,m going to try it, but first I,m going to check my liver levels, as I read all of you say it can make some damage...

I have been reading the links and I have another doubt:
-I take Inositol in a daily basis, is it safe to combine it with niacin?
The lipids super mega-article is so dense but soo interesting!!!
Thank you. My main problem is that I,m very hypocondriac and I don,t know if seeing me "flushing" can trigger an anxiety attack...

Wow. Thank you very mich. This is so informativr. I,m going to read the link now that I have some free time. My colesterol levels are all over the place. HDL super low, Ldh normal and Trig. very high. (Don,t have the numbers here). I don,t know if I must check my liver before trying niacin. I have been on medication for a long time (I was very depressed for a while).I,m not taking meds now (appart from a mild sleeping pill once a week or so) so I hope it,s ok, but I,m really concerned about the keto. I keep reading is very good for health improvement, but if I,m honest, I wonder if maybe for me is right (specially after seeing my blood panel). I,m afraid of going back to carbs and low fat, I was vegetarian for a while and I felt tired all day long and I kept gaining weight. So, I,m kind of waiting for my next blood test to see...

WRITING.TITLE: Cholesterol and niacin: worries
WRITING.TEXT:
Hello,
I'm a 31yo woman with high cholesterol. I've been on a keto diet for 5 months now and I got my test results two weeks ago, it showed high triglycerids and low hdl. I'm thinking about using niacin from what I've read here, but I'm worried about "the flush", maybe my concerns are silly, but I have a couple of questions:
Can someone be allergic to niacin? Could the flush make damages to the skin? Is it inconfortable? / Could the effect be too long? Could you recommend me a brand of niacin? (I live in Europe and I was thinking about Solgar, but if you now an European trusted brand that is not that expensive I would be thankful)

Hello everyone,
I need help to find an ejuice that I can vape all day long. Until last month I was vaping a lot of sweet e-juices, vainilla custard type, or caramel, chocolate, milkshakes, miky ones in general. I had a reaction to one liquid and know everything tastes too sweet and I can;t vape almost anything (I;m currently with Snake Oil, but I don;t like it very much). I don;t like tobacco flavour neither mentol, so now I;m lost. I live in Europe, so if you know brands that are sold here it;ll be perfect, but as long as I can find them online it works for me.
Thank you very much.

Hi. The Bp (Epiduo) I,ve use it a few years back when I had acne due to changing of city/weather. I bought the pink powder (Mizon's one) last month when I started to get really worried about my break outs... Since I read you I cut everything. I, m just using Avene micellar water, paula,s choice Cleanser gel and Heliocare sunscreen. I,ve used those before... But I feel my skin so dry, and I have a terriblr color, with redness and marks all over. :/ I,ll try to be patient... Thanks a lot.
Thank you, I hope so. I can't go back because I used too many things and before that I was using just a cleanser and a sunscreen...
Thanks! I have a ceramides moisturizer sample, as soon as I get cleared (if that eventually happens :( ) I'll try it.
Thank you very much. I have one question: what do I do to remove the acne? I've been using BP and pink powder, it works, but I have new pimples all the time... Can I still use them?

Hi everyone,
I'm so sad. About two months ago I introduced some korean and american products to help with my skin, which was oily and lacked glow and with severe PIH that really worried me. Firsts two weeks my skin was trully better, I was so shocked with the change, it was soft and hidrated and looked so even. Then, I started breaking out badly. I realized it was my fault because I had introduced everything at the same time. Then I reduced it to 4 products but still a lot of CC's and whiteheads and redness. I thought it was the oil balm cleanser at that point. I removed it from my routine.
Well, now, I'm so depressed and worried because I'm afraid of everything. My question really is, how do I reset? I have active acne, a lot of scars and PIH, everything itches... Like, what do I do?
(I've seen the dermatologist and he prescribed me a sunscreen and a cleanser that I used alone for a while, my face started to dry out like crazy and didn't get better neither...)
I really need to know how to reset my skin...

Hello everyone,
I need help to find an ejuice that I can vape all day long. Until last month I was vaping a lot of sweet e-juices, vainilla custard type, or caramel, chocolate, milkshakes, miky ones in general. I had a reaction to one liquid and know everything tastes too sweet and I can't vape almost anything (I'm currently with Snake Oil, but I don't like it very much). I don't like tobacco flavour neither mentol, so now I'm lost. I live in Europe, so if you know brands that are sold here it'll be perfect, but as long as I can find them online it's works for me.
Thank you very much.
I bought this one: "KAO BIORE UV PERFECT FACE MILK SUNSCREEN LOTION SPF50+ PA+++ SEBUM-ABSORBING" I hope is the same one! :) The bottle is white. Thanks for the advise.

Thanks. I've see if I can get a sample somewhere, here La Roche Posay is the most popular sunscreen, I've tried the compact powder but I prefer Heliocare in that format, but it feels too thick for summer. Thank you very much for your nice answer.

ello!
I've bought the Biore Watery Essence not long ago, my first asian sunscreen, and I'm so happy with it. I live in a very hot humid weather and I a swim, and I've read that Biore isn't water or sweat proof. So I'm looking for a everyday one and one waterproof-sports. I have oily acne prone skin and it took me so long to find a sunscreen that really suits me. I've research in reddit, and I see many options, but I'm so confused about what can I choose.
I would like that it feels kind of like Biore, essence or gel type, not white cast, not thick. If it has a mate finish will be perfect too.
Do you have any advise?
Sorry. :(
I'm using this one, but I've read that is no water proof or sweat proof, do you know a similar one (specially in texture) that is?

WRITING.TITLE: Can you recommend me a sweat and water proof sunscreen?
WRITING.TEXT: [removed]

haha. Wow I,m still recovering from my non-patching-it-can,t-be-that-bad experience lol. I,ll do the group of pictures in a few weeks when I,ve tested everything, if you wantto read it, in another reply here I named the products I bought. :)
Me too :)

Yes! I'm so happy with Jolse. I live in Spain and there are some online shops that charges a lot to ship here or they don't do it at all, I either buy from Jolse or directly from Ebay trusted seller of the AB list.
I bought it directly from Jolse, I didn't know they have an Amazon store!

Ah hehe, yes of course. I got:
* **Petitfee Gold EGF Eye Spot Patch (90 units)** - I've tried before and really love them, I have sensitive eyes and dark circles, and they feel nice and seem to improve fine lines. * **Petitfee Black Pearl Gold Eye Patch (60 units)** - I bought this for my father because he tried one of my Gold EGF and love them, and I wanted to have the other version to try them both, but I haven't bought them before. * **Innisfree Orchid Gel Cream** First time. I wanted a fresh not sticky gel cream for day-time. I have oily skin but somehow dehydrated, and last time I bought Snail Bee High Content Steam Cream (Benton) and I really like it but it feels kind of thick under the sunscreen so I use it at night. So, I'm going to try this. It smells great! * **Tonymoly The Fresh Phytoncide Pore Gel Cream** I tried this one before from some samples and really love it, I bought it for day-time too in case the Inissfree one don't work for me, as I know my skin likes this one. * **It's skin Collagen Voluming Toner** This one is for my mum, she already has the essence and another product that I don't remember from this line and she really loves the smell and texture, so she asked me for the toner as her actual one is finishing (The FACE Shop Clean Face Blemish Zero Clarifying Toner that really, is one of the best toners I've seen, but I use Klairs Supple preparation facial toner because I'm sensitive and this one, I know I have no problems with it). * **Cosrx BHA Blackpower Liquid** - I tried in samples and really like it. I,m just going to use it in my nose area mostly. Maybe try it later in all my face, but now I have another non asian BHA that I have to finish. * **Missha Artistool Concealer Brush** I just bought this one because in my last order I bought the Skinfood concealer and my brush (Bobby Brown one) is old. I hope it works fine!
Samples (last time they forget to include my samples and I told them, so this time they included a lot of them from both orders):
* **Goodal sample kit (toner, gel and eye cream)**. I gave it to my mum because I use the Goodal Moisture Barrier Cream since I discovered it, I have the craziest most sensitive eyes and this cream has been a game changer for me, before it I tried like 20 kinds and either made me cry or completely dried my under eyes (Except from Talika Detox, which is kind of expensive for me, but works well) still I prefer Goodal and my dark circles have improved a lot. I'll buy it again over and over :) * **Holika Holika Skin Good Cera Ultra Emulsion** - I haven't tried it, but I've wanted to try a Ceramides cream for a while and see how this one goes (I was thinking about Rossette from Japan, I've read some good reviews). * **TEa Tree sheet mask, Etude House** Never tried it, in fact I'm kind of scare about TEa TRee things, they've broke me out before, so I think I'll give it to someone. * **Lioele Blooming Shimmer Pearl Base, Illuminating primer** - I have never heard about it, will tell another time :) * **Lioele Beyond The Solution BB cream** I have never heard about it, will tell another time :) * **Etude House Fresh Cherry Tint** I've tried from a sample before, is nice, I don't use to wear lip glosses, I think is the red colour again, is beautiful, not very red. * **It's skin Mangowhite Cleansing cream** I'm going to try it some time soon, I'm scared because cleansing creams use to break me out so I'll check the ingredients first. * A lot of Tonymoly samples of foam and gel creams and the Black Snail Toner (I don't remember the brand) that I gave to my mum so I don't have them here... * **Jolse Blotting paper** I'm keeping it in my purse. My face is shinny after a few hours and I use Innisfree no sebum powder that is great, I'll keep this in case.
And a hand a nails cream that I don't find the name anywhere in the package but it smells great and have like a vintage packaging so lovely :)
